questions.question: Television helped bring about economic growth in the 1950's through its:

choices.answer: Financial programs
Children's programs
Credit cards
Advertisements

questions.question: All of the following are true of advertising in the 1950's EXCEPT:

choices.answer: TV commercials were purely informational
Advertisers focused their commercials for a certain audience
Commercials often used flashy images,mixed with music, and used celebrities
Advertising executives were highly paid professionals

questions.question: William J. Levitt contributed to the growth of the suburbs by

choices.answer: Mass-producing houses
Criticizing urban life
Designing interstate highways
Providing low-interest mortgage loans

questions.question: The post-war “baby boom” was strongly influenced by

choices.answer: Very high employment rates
Americans making more money than ever before
General prosperity
All of the above

questions.question: Buying a product on credit allowed customers to do all of the following EXCEPT:

choices.answer: Buy something that they might be not be able to normally afford
Get a product immediately while paying for it later
Get certain products for free
Pay for an item in fixed amounts

questions.question: Which of the following BEST characterizes the youth culture of the 1950s?

choices.answer: More young people were choosing to work rather than attend college
Radio programs became more popular amongst teenagers
They had more leisure (free) time to dedicate to entertainment and fun
Automobiles had little influence on the life of teens

questions.question: In the 1950s men’s roles usually included all of the following EXCEPT:

choices.answer: Making important family decisions
Supporting their families financially
Cooking, cleaning, and managing the household
Going to college

questions.question: The traditional role of the housewife called for her to:

choices.answer: Contribute an income to the family
Home school their children
Attend a university to get an education, act as a role model for the child
Support the husband through domestic chores

questions.question: Many parents in the 1950s had issues with Elvis Presley for all of the following reasons EXCEPT:

choices.answer: They believed he might cause a rise in immorality amongst teenagers
They believed his music was tied to the African American race
He was becoming more popular than the Beatles
His sexualized dance moves

questions.question: Rock and Roll gave the young people of the 1950s

choices.answer: a way to conform with their parents’ expectations
the values they needed to live through the depression and war
a stable and secure cultural role
a new style of music they could call their own
advocating equality for women.
advocating equality for everyone.
performing jazz music to a rock and roll beat.
rejecting many norms of American society.

questions.question: One of the aspects of American society in the 50's that drew criticism was

choices.answer: the loss of individuality
the baby boom
the arms race
the large number of Americans moving to the Sunbelt.

questions.question: Which event of the 50's led to the increase in government spending on education?

choices.answer: Russians put cosmonauts on the moon.
The Soviets launched the Sputnik satellite.
The U.S. was defeated in the Korean War.
American students scored low on tests in math and science.
